intro: Schoenoplectiella jingmenensis, commonly known as the Jingmen marsh grass, is a rare aquatic plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and shallow water bodies. Its morphology includes slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers. It plays an important ecological role in maintaining wetland biodiversity and water quality.
